thinking: I need to navigate to the account settings to find location sharing settings. I can see an 'Account' button with index [1] in the top right corner of the screen. This is likely where I'll find user settings including privacy and location settings.

Now that I've clicked on the 'Account' button, I can see a dropdown menu with two options: 'Settings' and 'Logout'. To turn off location sharing, I need to access the settings page, so I should click on the 'Settings' option (index [1]).

To turn off location sharing, I need to find where the location settings are controlled. Looking at the sidebar menu, I see several options including 'Account', 'Data Protection', 'Safety', 'Content', and 'Privacy'. Location sharing would most likely be under 'Data Protection' or 'Privacy'. I'll start by checking 'Data Protection' as it sounds most relevant to controlling what data the platform can access, including location data.

I've explored the Data Protection section, but don't see any specific settings related to location sharing. The settings here are about usage analytics, third-party data sharing, and marketing communications, but nothing specifically about location access. Looking at the sidebar menu again, 'Privacy' seems like the next logical place to check for location sharing settings since privacy settings often include location permissions.

I can now see the 'Share my location' option with a checkbox that is currently checked (enabled). This is exactly what I need to disable to turn off location sharing on this platform. The checkbox appears at index [13] and the description indicates it 'Allow others to see your general location in your profile and posts.' I'll click on this checkbox to toggle it off.

I can see that I've been moved to a completely different task. The previous task about turning off location sharing has been completed successfully. Now I'm presented with a new task information page that explains I need to buy disposable paper plates from a shopping website. The page contains personal information that I'll need to use during checkout. There's a 'Continue' button (index [1]) that I should click to start the shopping task.
